messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Grrl-power movies
messages.msgSnippet: ... You left off a really good one:  Lord of the Rings: Return of the King.  When Eowyn casts off the traditional role of the woman who stays at home while
messages.messageBody:
On 7/14/06, fullmoonfarm_mn <fullmoonfarm_mn@...> wrote:
> Hi,all-- we're looking for what you think are some awesome girl-
> empowering movies, esp for girls entering puberty. I've got a small
> list going, care to add?
>
> My List of Grrl-power movies
> 1. Miss Marple showws
> 2. Rosemary and Thyme shows
> 3. Fried Green Tomatoes
> 4. Tank Girl
> 5. A League of their Own
> 6. Beetlejuice
> 7. Harold and Maude

You left off a really good one: Lord of the Rings: Return of the King. When
Eowyn casts off the traditional role of "the woman who stays at home
while the men go off to fight" and then rips her helmet off and
declares "I am no man!" I was not the only person in the theater who
stood up and cheered!

Actually I like to look at movies in not so much terms of how they
empower women but how women and men treat each other. That's much
more important to me than big strong women characters. I want to see
films where I see women *and* men respecting each other. I get a sick
feeling in my stomach from films where women trample men as much as I
do from films where men trample on women. Maybe it comes from having
a son and wanting all my children to have healthy relationships and
respect in those relationships.
--
Michelle
aka Melbrigða
http://eventualknitting.blogspot.com
MedHS@yahoogroups.com - Homeschooling for the Medieval Recreationist

messages.subject: Grrl-power movies
messages.msgSnippet: Hi,all-- we re looking for what you think are some awesome girl- empowering movies, esp for girls entering puberty.  I ve got a small list going, care to add?
messages.messageBody:
Hi,all-- we're looking for what you think are some awesome girl-
empowering movies, esp for girls entering puberty. I've got a small
list going, care to add?

My List of Grrl-power movies
1. Miss Marple showws
2. Rosemary and Thyme shows
3. Fried Green Tomatoes
4. Tank Girl
5. A League of their Own
6. Beetlejuice
7. Harold and Maude

Thanks for your ideas-
Dawn
